snippet: A woman believed to be the first mentally disabled person in the nation to receive a major transplant has died.    The woman, Sandra Jensen, a Down syndrome patient who received a heart-lung transplant last year after having first been rejected be...
lead_paragraph: A woman believed to be the first mentally disabled person in the nation to receive a major transplant has died. The woman, Sandra Jensen, a Down syndrome patient who received a heart-lung transplant last year after having first been rejected because doctors thought her incapable of handling follow-up care, died on Friday at Sutter General Hospital. An autopsy will be conducted.
abstract: Sandra Jensen, a Down's syndrome patient who received a heart-lung transplant last year and became pioneer case prompting California legislation banning discrimination against disabled people who need transplants, dies at age 36 (S)

headline.main: Heart-Lung Recipient Who Had Disability Dies
